name: Lake Victoria
hint: Largest lake in Africa, source of the White Nile, shared by three countries

name: Lake Tanganyika
hint: Longest freshwater lake in the world, second deepest after Baikal

name: Lake Malawi
hint: Third-largest lake in Africa, famous for its cichlid fish diversity

name: Lake Chad
hint: Historically large lake that has shrunk dramatically, bordering four nations in the Sahel

name: Lake Turkana
hint: Largest permanent desert lake in the world, in northern Kenya

name: Lake Albert
hint: One of the African Great Lakes, on the Uganda-DRC border

name: Lake Kivu
hint: One of the African Great Lakes, on the Rwanda-DRC border, contains dissolved methane

name: Lake Tana
hint: Largest lake in Ethiopia, source of the Blue Nile

name: Lake Bangweulu
hint: Large shallow lake and wetland system in northeastern Zambia

name: Lake Mweru
hint: Lake on the border of Zambia and the Democratic Republic of Congo

name: Lake Volta
hint: One of the largest man-made lakes in the world by surface area, in Ghana

name: Lake Kariba
hint: Largest man-made lake by volume, on the Zambia-Zimbabwe border behind a massive dam

name: Lake Nasser
hint: Massive reservoir behind the Aswan High Dam in southern Egypt

name: Lake Edward
hint: One of the African Great Lakes, shared by Uganda and DRC in the Rift Valley

name: Lake Natron
hint: Extremely alkaline red lake in Tanzania, major breeding ground for flamingos

name: Lake Nakuru
hint: Shallow soda lake in Kenya's Rift Valley famous for enormous flocks of flamingos

name: Lake Assal
hint: Lowest point in Africa and the most saline lake in the world, in Djibouti

name: Lake Cabora Bassa
hint: Large reservoir on the Zambezi River in Mozambique, created by a major dam

name: Lake Kyoga
hint: Shallow lake in central Uganda, through which the Victoria Nile flows

name: Lake Bosumtwi
hint: Natural lake in Ghana formed by an ancient meteorite impact crater
